class phys::World

Detailed Description

This is the base class from which all the actors inherit.

The actor classes store and manage all the relevant data regarding objects inside the World. They serve as a binder between the physics and graphics for objects and have functions that allow the manipulation of objects loaded into the World. Currently there are 4 actor classes: ActorBase, ActorDynRigid, ActorDynSoft, and ActorSta.
ActorBase is a base class that serves as a template for the other three actor classes.
ActorBase should never be created, as it lacks the functionality needed for most objects.

String  file,
String  group,
World *  _World 
)

Descriptive constructor.

This constructor contains the basic information needed to make an actor.

Parameters:
Name The name of the actor.
File The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
Group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.
_World Pointer to the World this object will be added to.

virtual void phys::ActorBase::AddObjectToWorld ( World *  TargetWorld,
btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld *  btWorld 
) [protected, pure virtual]

Adds the actor to the physics world.

Adds the actor to the physics world.
This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
TargetWorld Pointer to the World class.
btWorld Pointer to the physics world.

Implemented in phys::ActorRigid, and phys::ActorSoft.

void phys::ActorBase::AttachToGraphics (  )  [protected]

Makes the actor visable.

Adds the actor to all the nessessary graphics elements to make it visable on screen.
This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't ever need to be called manually.

String  file,
String  group 
) [protected]

Creates an entity for the mesh file to be placed on a scene node.

Creates an entity in the scene manager from the mesh file provided to be attached to a node in the graphical world.
This function is called on by the Constructor, and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
Name Name of the actor.
File File name of the graphical mesh to be used.
Group Resource group where the graphical mesh can be found.

Creates a node for the entity in the graphical world.

btTriangleMesh * phys::ActorBase::CreateTrimesh (  )  [protected]

Creates a trimesh shape from the mesh file.

Makes a trimesh to be used as a collision shape in the physics world from a mesh file.
This is automaticly called by the CreateShapeFromMesh function in child classes and shouldn't be called manually.

void phys::ActorBase::SetBulletLocation ( PhysVector3  Location  )  [protected, virtual]

Sets the location of the physics body.

This will take a PhysVector3 and set the location of the actor within the physics world.
This function is called on by the SetLocation function, and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
Location The PhysVector3 representing the location.

Definition at line 266 of file physactor.cpp.

void phys::ActorBase::SetInitLocation ( PhysVector3  Location  ) 

Sets the starting location of the actor.

Calling this function after adding it to the World will have no effect.
This function will set where the actor will be located in the World when it is first placed inside the world.

Parameters:
Location The PhysVector3 representing the location.

Sets the starting orientation of the actor.

Calling this function after adding it to the World will have no effect.
This function will set where the actor is facing in the World when it is first placed inside the world.

Parameters:

Definition at line 300 of file physactor.cpp.

void phys::ActorBase::SetKinematic (  ) 

Sets the state of the object to Kinematic.

This function will set the object to a Kinematic Object.
Kinematic Objects are like Static Objects but are also able to be moved directly by character controllers.

Definition at line 332 of file physactor.cpp.

void phys::ActorBase::SetLocation ( PhysVector3  Place  ) 

Manually sets the location of the actor.

Calling this function prior to adding it to the World will have no effect.
In most situations you won't want to use this function, and instead produce movement through physics functions.

Parameters:
Place The PhysVector3 representing the location.

In most situations you won't want to use this function, and instead produce movement through physics functions.

Definition at line 305 of file physactor.cpp.

void phys::ActorBase::SetStatic (  ) 

Sets the state of the object to Static.

This function will set the object to a Static Object.
Static Objects don't move or have any force applied to them, but are cabable of exerting force on other objects.
